Comparison of salaries: The expert compared the annual salaries of the top officials at the Port Authority with the salaries of New Jersey Governor Chris Christie and New York Governor Andrew Cuomo. This comparison was used to verify the claim that many top agency officials earn more money than the governors.
Official data: The expert relied on the latest data released by the Port Authority, which provided information on the annual salaries of its employees. This data was used to determine the salaries of the top 12 positions listed on the agency's organization chart.
Verification of claim: The expert cross-referenced the salaries of the top officials at the Port Authority with the salaries of the governors to verify the claim made by New Jersey Assemblyman John Wisniewski. By confirming that 11 out of the 12 top officials earned more than the governors, the expert supported the claim's authenticity.
Corroboration of statement: The expert's verdict confirmed that the figures obtained from the comparison and official data supported the statement made by John Wisniewski. The expert's analysis provided additional evidence to back up the claim that many top officials at the Port Authority earn more money than the governors of the states that have jurisdiction over them.
